docs.title: QTE — Quantum Series Encoder
docs.text: Polylog AC (auto/mp/series), Bessel (J_n), QFT labels with [rail], Maclaurin helpers, caching, CLI.

docs.title: Quick start
docs.text: ```bash pip install -r requirements.txt ./qte_cli.py --nq 6 --mode terms --label 'QFT[sin(2pix); N=64; a=0; b=1; ifft][rail]' ./qte_cli.py --value --label 'polylog(2, 1.1)'

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Value mode (polylog continuation, auto backend):

QTE_POLYLOG_BACKEND=auto ./qte_cli.py --value --label "polylog(2, 1.1)"

QFT with rail mapping (normalized 64-vector):

./qte_cli.py --nq 6 --mode terms --label "QFT[sin(2*pi*x); N=64; a=0; b=1; ifft][rail]"

Bessel value:

./qte_cli.py --value --label "J2(1.0)"

Maclaurin (real coeffs, auto radius):

./qte_cli.py --nq 4 --mode terms --label "Maclaurin[log(1+x); auto_r; real_coeffs]"

Backends: - auto prefers mpmath; else series/Euler accel - mp forces mpmath.polylog - series uses internal series (|z|<1) + Euler accel for z∈(-1,0)

Caching:

./qte_cli.py --value --label "Li(3,0.9)" --cache

import series_encoding as se
se.qte_cache_clear()

docs.title: Smoke/batch
docs.text:
python3 tests_qte.py
python3 paper_batch.py
python3 paper_multi.py
python3 special_values_table.py

docs.title: Cache API
docs.text:
import series_encoding as se
se.qte_cache_clear()
print('cache cleared')
